sec.title: NCAA to Allow Access to Member Website for NCAA Team Physicians
sec.p: The National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) has agreed to grant access to the member side of NCAA.org for AOSSM members who are serving as a team physician for an NCAA institution. The NCAA member website has links to numerous resources and information (eg, topical articles, forms, rule changes) that are not available on the public side of the site. The website content includes information about rules and bylaws, eligibility, compliance, drug testing, recruiting, scholarships, and calendars. Of perhaps greatest interest to AOSSM members is the Health and Safety page, which has links to educational materials on issues of greatest concern to the NCAA (eg, sickle cell trait, concussions, substance abuse). Fact sheets that provide NCAA injury data summaries for women’s volleyball, men’s and women’s soccer, football, and field hockey can be downloaded with information for other sports to be available soon. Researchers who are interested in obtaining de-identified data from the NCAA Injury Surveillance Program can obtain information about how to request these data. Members are also able to sign up for an e-mail alert for new postings of material.

To request access to the members’ side of NCAA.org, please send your name, preferred e-mail address, and college or university affiliations with sports covered to AOSSM Director of Research Bart Mann (bart@aossm.org).

sec.title: AOSSM Traveling Fellowship Tour Goes to Asia Pacific in 2013
sec.p: Applications are now being accepted for the 2013 AOSSM/APOSSM (APKASS) Traveling Fellowship Tour.

Dr Allen Anderson from Tennessee Orthopaedic Alliance has been selected to be the Godfather for the AOSSM/APKASS Traveling Fellowship tour. Dr Anderson was a former traveling fellow in 1989, traveling to the Asia Pacific region. He has also been on the AOSSM Board of Directors and the Medical Publishing Board of Trustees. The tour will tentatively take place for 4 weeks starting around May 21st at the 2013 JOA Congress in Hiroshima, Japan and ending around June 18th. Tentative stops are Hiroshima and Kobe, Japan; Beijing and Shanghai, China; Hong Kong; Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; and Singapore.

The requirements and application to become a Traveling Fellow can be downloaded at www.sportsmed.org, under the About tab and then clicking on Traveling Fellowships.All applications must be received by the Society no later than October 31, 2012. We are also looking for traveling fellowship hosts for the North American tour. If you are interested, visit www.sportsmed.org or contact Debbie Czech (e-mail: Debbie@aossm.org; tel: 847-292-4900).

sec.title: Fall Is Here—Help Prevent Sports Injuries in Kids
sec.p: If you haven’t already joined the STOP Sports Injuries campaign or donated, it’s easy to get involved; simply fill out the online form under the Join Our Team tab and submit your sporting organization, hospital/institution, or practice bio and logo to Campaign Director Michael Konstant at michael@stopsportsinjury.org. We will then add your information to the site, and you will have access to a specialized logo to place on your website and utilize in presentations, events, or other materials. sec.title: Check Out the Current Concepts in AJSM and Earn CME Credits
sec.p: Where can you find the most up-to-date information on critical clinical topics in sports medicine? Current Concepts, the journal-based CME activity, is available each month in AJSM. Reflect and evaluate research-based information you can use in your practice while you earn AMA PRA Category 1 Credit™. Log on to www.ajsm.org for more information.

sec.title: Got News We Could Use? Sports Medicine Update Wants to Hear From You!
sec.p: Have you received a prestigious award recently? A new academic appointment? Been named a team physician? AOSSM wants to hear from you! Sports Medicine Update welcomes all members’ news items. Please send information to Lisa Weisenberger, AOSSM Director of Communications, at lisa@aossm.org, fax to 847-292-4905, or contact the Society office at 847-292-4900. High-resolution (300 dpi) photos are always welcomed.

sec.title: Announcements
sec.p: The HEIDELBERG LIVE-SURGERY CASTLE MEETING 2012 on Hip and Knee will be held October 11 to 13, 2012 at the Historic Heidelberg Castle, Heidelberg, Germany. The meeting will include many LIVE surgeries and instructional video presentations on hip and knee arthroscopy and resurfacing by an international faculty. For information and to register, visit our website at www.heidelberg-castle-meeting.de.

The 10th ANNUAL ACL WORKSHOP will be held on Saturday, November 10, 2012 in Cincinnati, Ohio. The ACL workshop is a day dedicated to the prevention, training, and rehabilitation of athletes who are at risk for ACL injuries. Our world-renowned team at The Ohio State University Sports Medicine and the Human Performance Laboratory in the Sports Medicine Biodynamics Center at Cincinnati Children’s Hospital will detail the latest prevention programs for female athletes. There will be a major focus on hands-on workshops, and we will utilize state-of-the-art 3D motion analysis to teach athlete screening techniques and neuromuscular training methods that focus on proper core and knee control and landing techniques. For more information or to register for the workshop, please go to www.regonline.com/aclworkshop.

The 8th ADVANCED COURSE ON SHOULDER ARTHROSCOPY OF VAL d’ISÈRE will be held January 20 to 25, 2013, at the Centre de Congres in Val d’Isère France. The meeting will take place over a week in the wonderful resort of Val d’Isère, with lectures, discussions, and debates concerning all the aspects of shoulder arthroscopy. Participants will receive a DVD of all surgical demonstrations and interactive discussions and votes will be available during the course. Participants will earn CME Credits. For information please visit our website at www.valdisereshoulder.com.

The 1st INTERNATIONAL WINTER HIP COURSE: Current Trends, will be held February 13 to 16, 2013, in Val d’Isère France. The course will include scientific sessions, video projections, and industry surgical demonstrations. The official language is English. For more information contact Centrede Congrès Henri Oreiller, Route de la Balme, 73150Val d’Isère. TEL: 33 4 79 06 21 23; FAX: 33 4 79 06 19 04. Website: www.hip-course.com. E-mail: info@hip-course.com.
